item.title: Report X-2024060420
item.description:
Report X-2024060420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS STOPPED FOR AN INSPECTION DUE TO THE BOX HAVING A HANDWRITTEN MARKING STATING BATTERY POWERED OPEN WHEN IT ARRIVES. THE OUTER BOX HAS A STICKER APPLIED HANDLE WITH CARE, DELICATE INSTRUMENTS, AND FRAGILE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE FLUKE 732B DC STANDARD CALIBRATION DEVICE CONTAINING A SEALED LEAD ACID (NON-SPILLABLE) GEL BATTERY INSIDE THE DEVICE. A STICKER ON THE DEVICE INDICATES BATTERY REPLACED 2022-05-04. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. NONSPILLABLE BATTERY IS NOT INDICATED ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024060459
item.description:
Report X-2024060459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY THE LVD PICK OFF ON THE PD-4. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE TURNED OFF THE POWER AND SECURED THE CONVEYOR BELT, EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS PH TESTED AND CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS SLIGHTLY LOOSE, CAUSING APPROX. 8 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • City: W VALLEY CITY

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1123 were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1123-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, as well as the impacted pallet, and damaged product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums which were staged onsite for future disposal.

THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER RY6239, GATORADE SPORTS, 404 W HARRISON, CHICAGO IL 60607.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 30, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2014 was punctured due to an unknown cause and released approximately 50-gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt/gravel below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel performed a tote transfer and labeled the tote for onsite disposal. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the released product. All waste was containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SOUTH SORT AISLE. THE SORTER NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE SIDE OF THE BOX. THERE WAS A MILD ODOR COMING FROM IT. HE STOPPED, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED DMP SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. DETERMIND TO BE A POSSILE UNDECLARED SHIPMENT.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 2-gallon plastic jerrican. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed a granular absorbent and neutralizer to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The damaged jerrican was placed into one (1) additional 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024060019
item.description:
Report I-2024060019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES -ROSALIND SHELMIRE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Halfway through the flight, passenger 20A, HOLUB/ALEXEIDAVID, told FA Pang that their laptop was emitting an electrical smell. FA conferred with FM and both agreed there was a smell. No flames, heat, or smoke were present. Out of an abundance of caution, the MacBook Pro was placed into the TCB. The TCB was placed in an aft Iav and monitored occasionally per CA instructions occasionally throughout the flight. The TCB remained in the aft Iav until descent, in which it was brought to the forward Iav for easy access upon door opening. Due to no signs of fire, smoke, or heat, pax was escorted to the exit and was able to retrieve the laptop out of the TCB. FAs reminded to fill out IORs and thanked for erring on the side of caution. Name: Alex Eidavid Holub Address: 36 Mayflower Drive Wenham MA 01984 , Phone: 626-676-1736 Email: alexholub@gmail.com

  • Description: A MULTIPLE PACKAGE AIR SHIPMENT WAS NOTED ON THE THERMAL LABELS TO CONTAIN 13 TABLETS. PACKAGES WERE SET ASIDE FOR OPEN BOX INSPECTION. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS ALL NINE PACKAGES CONTAINED THIRTEEN SAMSUNG GALAXY FESTIVAL POINT OF SALE MOBILE PAYMENT TABLETS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS IN THE SHIPMENT ARE 1Z6R58830195457796, 1Z6R58830196536458, 1Z6R58830196095845, 1Z6R58830199530672, 1Z6R58830196800019, 1Z6R58830196648060, 1Z6R58830196827625 AND 1Z6R58830197226237.

item.description:
Report X-2024051808

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: Welshpool
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/29/2024 at approximately 0800, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification from Employee 4992313 at the ramp facilty in Welshpool of an undeclared dangerous goods shipment. The shipment consists of one fiberboard box, containing 4 individual bottles of retail perfume. The accompanying safety data sheet incorrectly identified the commodity as "body lotion". The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, as it was not properly marked and label, and did not have the required packaging and paperwork. The shipment was discovered via x-ray at customs, prompting the opening of the pacakge for verification. The shipment to being prepared for disposal.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED ON THE EXTENDO ON DOOR 3, EMPLOYEE NOTICED THAT IT WAS LEAKING. THEY TURNED THE BELTS OFF AND NOTIFIED A SUPERVISOR WHO NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. UPON ARRIVING TO THE LEAKING PKG THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER INSPECTED AND THE ODOR WAS VERY NOXIOUS AND FOLLOWING HIS DECISION TREE NOTIFED THE SUPERVISOR AS WE DO NOT HAVE SCBA. THE AREA WAS CORDONED OFF AND WE OPENED ALL THE DOORS FOR VENTILATION. WE THEN NOTIFIED BASE AND AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO CLEANUP THE SPILL.

item.title: Report X-2024060112
item.description:
Report X-2024060112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: Vernon
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/19/24, we received notification from hub personnel that a foul odor was emitting from ISO tank SUTU 266444. The tank was labeled with the commodity "POLYSULFIDE 9. MARINE POLLUTANT" (UN 3082, HAZMAT), prompting to call out an environmental contractor United Pumping to assess the incident. The responder discovered several loose bolts on the top manway hatch. The product inside the tank appeared to be stable, with no residue or spillover on the top area of the tank. It seems the loose bolts found on the top hatch cover allowed vapor to escape, causing the foul odor. After tightening the bolts, the odor dissipated over some time. The seals on the top hatch remained intact and undamaged.

item.title: Report X-2024051203
item.description:
Report X-2024051203

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: Manuelito
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 235000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: X-2024051203: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. NATX 400688 suffered jacket damage and some dents. The car suffered a 19"x2" heat-induced tear on the "B-end". This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051204: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 952565 suffered jacket damage and some dents. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, the tank suffered what appears to be a heat-induced tear measuring about 6"x1" on the top of the tank, underneath the jacket. The tank also had a significant blister at this point as well. Significant heat damage to protective housing as well. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051207: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 955642 suffered jacket damage and some dents. The tank suffered a puncture/tear toward the A-end of the car measuring about 2'x3'. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051208: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 954193 suffered jacket damage and some dents on each end, but no container failure. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, all gaskets/o-rings were burnt out from valves under the protective housing and product burned from these orifices. The protective housing also had significant damage. This car had burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051209: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 959911 suffered jacket damage and some dents including a significant B-end head dent, but no container failure. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, all gaskets/o-rings were burnt out from valves under the protective housing and product burned from these orifices. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051210: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 953969 suffered jacket damage and some dents including a dent on each end, but no container failure. This car did have multiple PRD venting cycles due to being exposed to heat/fire for hours. This car was liquid flared and then vapor flared to remove all remaining product.

item.title: Report E-2024060074
item.description:
Report E-2024060074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: LANTAU
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING NORMAL HANDLING PROCESS AT THE UPS HONG KONG INTERNATIONAL CHEK LAP KOK FACILITY ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM HONG KONG DESTINED TO THE USA WAS OBSERVED SMOKING ON THE BELT. THE PACKAGE WAS IMMEDIATELY TAKEN AWAY FROM THE BELT AND PLACED IN A SEGREGATED AREA. THE SMOLDERING INCREASED AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE PACKAGE BEGAN BURNING. UPS STAFF USED A FIRE EXTINGUISHER TO EXTINGUISH THE FIRE. THE EVENT WAS DISCOVERED PRIOR TO THE PACKAGE BEING LOADED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER. THE PACKAGE HAD PASSED A DANGEROUS GOODS ACCEPTANCE AUDIT PRIOR TO THE LITHIUM BATTERY INCIDENT. THE PACKAGE WAS FULLY DECLARED WITH AN APPROPRIATE IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION AS UN3480 LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, SECTION IA OF PACKING INSTRUCTION 965. AFTER THE EVENT WAS EXTINGUISHED, THE OPERATIONS NOTED THE INNER THREE BATTERIES WERE NOT PROPERLY SEPARATED OR PROTECTED. ADDITIONALLY, NO WATT HOUR MARKINGS WERE FOUND ON THE BATTERIES. PER 49CFR 171.15, THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER WAS CONTACTED BY TELEPHONE TO REPORT THE INCIDENT. THE OFFICER WAS UNABLE TO ACCEPT THE TELEPHONE REPORT DUE TO THE EVENT NOT OCCURRING IN THE USA.

One of the bottles had a streak of liquid leaked on to its body that is coming from under the cap. When the cap was opened, the seal was opened a quarter of the way.   • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3149 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew tightened the cap and utilized absorbent pads to remediate the release. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged jug was overpacked into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024051843
item.description:
Report X-2024051843

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found by Ops Admin ID9160575 leaking on Belt 1 around 8:20am at back of Belt. Manager ID2546442 was questioned about origin of damaged hazmat. Manager stated hazmat package came down from overhead belt At beginning of sort around 4:50am damaged and leaking. She let package ride to the back of sorting belt to await Admin arrival for her work area. Management or present QA in other work areas were not notified of the damaged Hazmat. She stated she forgot to tell admin for her work area when admin arrived around 5:45 to work area. Package sat at back of belt on rollers for approximately 4 hours. Upon discovery by Ops Admin around 8:20am Package was immediately taken to QA area for processing. Upon inspection discovered 2 containers of Chem-Aqua had loose caps and leaked approximately 2 quarts of liquid into box and on exterior of containers.

  • City: ATLANTA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05/19/2024, during boarding phase of flight DL453(ATL-SAN), a passengefs bag in the overhead bin at seat 10C was observed to be smoking along with a loud"pop" noise. The bag was removed and placed in the jetway where AFD discovered that the heat source was a camera battery. AFD extinguished the battery and TechOps was tasked with disposal. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No Flight Crew or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

  • Description: Fuel spill was from the tractor FUEL tank and not the DOT 406 trailer vessel. Reporting as a precaution due to the cleanup involved. Driver was backing due to be re-routed by law enforcement. Stuck a guardrail with the fuel tank on the tractor resulting in a spill of diesel fuel. CDG was contacted and managed the cleanup. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area with granular absorbents. The spent absorbents were gathered, and the recovered material and damaged pail was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

This shipment received a DPR, repack and RTS at MEML-386. Repack was shipped without a diamond label or other hazmat markings. No DGNav report or ISF was completed at the time of DPR. The original package also appears to have been undeclared.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE RESPONDED TO A DECLARED LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE HAD AN APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPER, DIAMOND LABEL AND MARKING OF UN2796 BATTERY FLUID ACID. THE PACKAGE HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACLILITY IN ILLINOIS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) ONE LITER BOTTLE OF GILL AIRCRAFT BATTERY ELECTROLYTE LEAKING FROM A PIN HOLE IN THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE.

item.title: Report E-2024050588
item.description:
Report E-2024050588

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: Manville
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/21/24, at 1100 hours, FRA Inspector Vincent Au in the CSXT Manville Yard discovered DNAX 130040, Residue tank car UN1993 Flammable Liquid (Acetone, Toluene) with an improperly placed manway gasket, and a vapor release from the vacuum release device. The railcar was isolated in yard, and National Response Center and New Jersey Department of Environment were notified, report number 24-05-23-1554-22. The emergency contact number on the waybill was contacted: 877-818-0087, Velocity Emergency Call Service, with Shipper Contact listed as David Solecki from Veolia Inc. CSX Manager of Hazardous Materials Graham Clark made contact with David Solecki and informed him of situation. MEI, a CSX response contractor was dispatched to the scene, and found the improperly placed manway gasket and defective vacuum relief device. MEI corrected the gasket placement, and removed the vacuum relief device, and put a plug in DNAX 130040. The plug secured the release, and corrective actions were communicated to David Solecki and FRA Inspector Vincent Au. The tank car has remained held from transportation pending receipt of an OTMA or further repair by certified repair unit.

The shipment is being disposed of as hazardous waste.

  • Description: On May 17th a package was discovered while loading onto the delivery vehicle. It had a heavy chemical smell but there were no markings on the outside shrink wrap to indicate that it contained DG. The AsTRA label did not indicate DG and there was no Shippers DGD. The shrinkwrap was opened to discover 4 bags of 1334, Naphthalene Refined, 4.1 with all DG markings on the package. The shipment has been held at the station pending disposition.

  • Description: Shipment from awb#73181183 got mixed with passenger bags and made its way to ANC baggage claim. It is a yellow cooler tote from Trader Joe's. Upon opening the bag, there were a large amount of nail polish bottles, nail glue, and nail dip powder found in the bag. Shipment flew already IAD-LAX flight 277/ 12May and LAX-ANC flight 193/ 13May.

item.title: Report E-2024050322
item.description:
Report E-2024050322

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: LOGAN
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/14/2024, at 1222 hours, personnel in the CSXT Peach Creek Yard, in Logan, WV, discovered CRDX 14064, a loaded hopper car of Ammonium Nitrate, leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, PCS SALES, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0514-00151). SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the release was due to a partially open slide gate on the bottom of the hopper car. CSX Mechanical personnel closed the slide gate and SPSI personnel remediated the product release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative (Amy James, 803-335-9164). The car was released for transportation.

item.description:
Report X-2024051259

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-12
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer came in to ship GSX to FAI 2 pcs declared a non-spillable battery in one box. I asked if there were any more batteries in the second box, apart from the first box that contained the non-spill battery. Customer said there was just the one non spillable, and aircraft parts in the other box. He seemed confused by my question and even said just so that we are on the same page. When I went to screen the boxes there indeed was non-spillable battery in one box. But the second box contained a 392Wh lithium-ion battery. This would have been on a passenger aircraft if not discovered.
